Review Text: A nice pub in the centre of Manchester, but not as much character as most others.  Clean and plenty of seating when we called Sunday afternoon.  Food good but would have liked more curry sauce on the chips, seemed abit stingy with it. Hallumi fried where good as was the quorn nuggets,  perfect for an afternoon sharing snack and good value at £16.80 for all 3.

A nice pub in the centre of Manchester, but not as much character as most others.  Clean and plenty of seating when we called Sunday afternoon.  Food good but would have liked more curry sauce on the chips, seemed abit stingy with it. Hallumi fried where good as was the quorn nuggets,  perfect for an afternoon sharing snack and good value at £16.80 for all 3.

I had it on my bucket list to have a proper full English breakfast. My partner grew up coming to this location when he lived in the city and so I obviously had to have my first taste here. The breakfast was very good and exactly what I wanted. I will definitely be back!

This second time I’ve been here
The location is amazing
I like even outdoors or indoors
Staff is very very helpful and high attitude
Just one think I would like to mention is cleaning of tables. It needs more care

We went here before catching train home and ordered x2 large breakfasts and 2 unlimited hot refill drinks, breakfast arrived it looked great so my husband started eating while I went for the hot drinks their were loads of flies all over the hot drink machines and when I got back I told my husband he laughed it off until a fly bothered him a lot while eating then flies landed on his toast and food we swatted it away and looked up and all the lamp shades were swarming with flies and large moths too and mould on the roof we felt a bit ill and left our food and as huge wetherspoons lovers we love every spoons we visit but this was not a pleasant experience at all and this seriously needs to be addressed and sorted

Went on a Wednesday night at 8:30, place was surprisingly quiet and tables were free. My steak was medium-rare which I wanted, and my boyfriend said his burger tasted good. Perfect place to go for food and drinks.

One of the better Wetherspoons in Manchester. The food arrives quickly,  and is tasty and good value, the only criticism is at the busy times the tables could be cleared quicker, maybe need more staff. As the staff who were working were working hard.
Had a lovely traditional breakfast. My sister had the eggs benedict. All meals were delicious.  Friendly staff. Clean toilets. Served very quickly.  We went at 11:15am and it was quite full already.
Great service and a superb breakfast to start the day. Opted for coffee rather than ale

Basic boozer. Cheap. Gets very busy. Fine if you can find a seat, not if you can't. There are lots of staff but it can still be difficult to get served quickly at the bar as they're dealing with food orders.

Ordered a chicken burger.
Plate came out surprisingly quickly. Looked like it had been thrown on the plate. Few chips bit into  the burger..... 🤮 it wasnt cooked at all!! Called over a member of staff told him his reply was well the chicken comes in ready cooked!!!! Do you want another one? Not a chance thanks. Not asked if i wanted a refund..
Wont eat there again  🤮🤮

My friend and I came to visit Manchester for the weekend on Sat 29th Oct 22 as we came for a show at the Manchester A.O Arena. On Sun 30th Oct 22, we wanted breakfast but missed Mc D's so I suggested a Wetherspoons as I know you can still order an all-day breakfast even if its past Breakfast Menu time.

We were staying nearby so didn't have far to walk to The Paramount. Upon arrival and entering on Sun - 30-10-22, it was extremely busy. It is a very big place but was quite packed which we soon discovered was due to a football match being on and screened. However, it didn't take long to find somewhere to sit, and we found a nice comfortable booth style table to sit at.

Ordering on the app is fast and straight-forward. We ordered the All-day brunch with some orange juice and didn't have to wait long to be served. The food was cooked well and very tasty. The chips were "THE BEST!" - Piping hot and crispy. My friend and I find Wetherspoons chains to be reliable and affordable.

Only gripe was the table felt a bit sticky and glasses were not cleared. We were bothered by a fly too. I understand the premises is very busy, but it would help if tables were cleaned.

Overall good experience. Good food and price. Can't complain!

Very busy, inside and out, minimal space outside to enjoy drinks in the non-smoking outdoor seats.
Good to see the place busy but was the weekend of Parklife.
Bar area was not too busy but was hard to get served.
Would go back as the atmosphere was great and the variety of customers was immense.
2 bouncers on the door to stop any mischief made me feel safe.
Very busy and loud but warm atmosphere, food service was fast and hot but didn't seem to be much food considering the price. Burger was small and so was the potion if chips.

Still a decent, clean and comfortable pub. Busy as usual but always happy to visit here. So many different seating options, booths, open area seating, upstairs. A small bottle of Procecco and a pint for under £6 you can't go wrong. Seems a well managed pub. Clean toilets.

I don’t expect a lot of a Wetherspoons pub, but this falls short even of that.
The first drink I wanted - and that according to the app they had in stock - had run out. So the other drink I wanted, that had run out as well. The third option? Run out too. Had a can of something that wasn’t all that cheap, so could have gone to a semi-decent pub instead.
Clientele? Arguing children.
Toilets? Three cubicles in the men’s in what is a fairly large pub. First cubicle? Out of service. Second cubicle? No toilet paper. Third cubicle? Toilet paper so tight in the receptacle that it could barely be rotated.
Sat at a table with eight empty glasses (not mine sadly), two plates of nasty looking leftover food and ripped-up beer mats etc.
Very poor establishment.

Ordered garlic bread it took 30 minutes  or more when it arrived at my table it was uncooked or under baked, and I took I back and showed it them it took an hour before I got anything because I had to remind them.

Witherspoon is always a vibe. We went there for lunch on a Thursday and yet the entire restaurant was caught up. However, we ordered a portion of fish and chips and an American double Patty burger. The food was fresh and was served in 10-12 minutes in spite of the fact that the restaurant was busy.

friendly security. drinks ordered on the app always timely. good prices for central manchester. often packed so check peak times to guarantee seating, although it is quite a large space. also has outdoor seating which is great in summer. overall a really great place to go for pres or a quick drink.

Absolutely love this pub!......... BUT...service is sooooooooo slow!! Having just two bar staff serving on the bar when its absolutely packed inside and out on a sunny Saturday just really isnt great been a few time over past few months and noticed this alot.... waited 40 minutes for a app order which was just a can as i wanted to see how long it took vs us cueing up 😅😅
On another positive the staff you do have, have always been very pleasant, polite and helpful!!
Did i mention the toilets arent miles away for a spoons so extra bonus xx
See you again very soon!!

A short weekend in Manchester...seen my team Argyle beat Bolton and had a good night out last night.....so...ofcourse...before we travel south 320 miles we need to have breakfast in "Spoons"!! Always good value...this place is modern and big and not a particularly archetypal Spoons. Food ok....so many people doing exactly the same on a Sunday morning. Can't ever fault it....

Arrived to find only one of the 5 beers advertised was on, and they had no jacket potatoes.  No loo roll in ladies cubicle (ok I should have checked first?) Need to check this place out Mr Martin. Not doing your reputation any good.

Food was good as usual, we raised a question about the sausage in a vegetarian breakfast wrap as I was unsure whether it was meat or not. Staff became increasingly defensive about it despite us assuring that we just wanted to know and not wanting to cause a dispute, even though it was just a question the member of staff asked involved her manager who was incredibly dismissive and made me feel quite uncomfortable (I felt like I was unable to get a word in). I will still come to weatherspoons, but this experience has deterred me from returning to The Paramount.
All the usual Spoons benefits and disadvantages. I.e. good value drinks, spacious, magnet for local alcoholics. Central location close to Oxford Street station. Quick service and outdoor seating.
Always a good clean tidy place. Usual spoons fare but well presented and cooked very good. Beers excellent service very good. An excellent example for wetherspoons

Typical Wetherspoons pub, quite large inside and quite dark as you get towards the back. Very quick service using the app with friendly staff and competitive prices.

Ordered a cooked breakfast and it came within 5 mins, everything well cooked and hot!
Very busy and lively city center pub, great situation for musems, art gallery and shops..
Got introduced to Pitchers!! and I am OBSESSED would definitely recommend. The paramount has friendly staff and nice food. Cheap but good quality drinks.
Excellent breakfast. Under £14 for small breakfast with extra black pudding, scrambled egg on toast, endless tea and coffee.
Love this place, cosy and warm. Plenty to choose from on the menu. Very reasonably priced.

An above average Wethers, good food and service, and a great atmosphere.
Perfect outdoor seating to watch the Folk of Manchester walk by.
Lots of road noise, but apart from that, a great meeting place.

The food was nice but the service was quite regular.

Tap water served in plastic cups feels awkward in a place like this.

Kids didn't have colours to paint their kids' menu, what a shame.
Great place for a beer and a meal. Fair prices and friendly staff
Hair in nachos, didn’t give it flavour so I don’t know why it was in there. Pizza was nice though 😊 …

My friend and I were enjoying ourselves when a creepy guy started talking to us. One of the bouncers intervened straight away and then came over to us briefly at the bar afterwards to make sure we were alright. It made us feel really safe and we were really impressed with the duty of care. We didn’t get his name but big love to that bouncer! <3
Went here for breakfast, clean non greasy English breakfast, my wife had pancakes with maple syrup. Nice and central, clean, polite staff and excellent value for money.

Due to this wetherspoons location being right in the middle of Manchester city centre it's mostly always busy. Usually lots of students due to the universitys surrounded it which in my opinion adds alot to the atmosphere. The food is avarage but also very affordable prices and they have a wide selection of alcoholic drinks and soft. I would definitely recommend

The customer did not apologize at first, and said a lot of insulting words like“fucking your language”“fucking ur country”and laughed with his friend. We went to the security staff for help, but the security staff thought that we would not accept the man's apology and even said that if we did this, we would be banned from drinking outside (I still remember the security staff), which was clearly a biased directive. Very bad experience, I hope you will not be treated like this.

We went in to order drinks of tea and coffee, and the person serving was not very helpful. We had to ask another person on the staff to tell us what was available. Three teas and a capuchin cost just £5 with free refills.
It was extremely busy, we managed to get a table and ordered on the app. Easy process and didn't have wait long for our order. I had the Miners Benedict which was lovely.
Great place to sit outside and people watch. Not the most stunning Wetherspoons interior you'll see but still good value as you would expect.

Good food.
Nothing special about the place. Lacks TV for sports.
Great prices for the beer 🍺
If in the city again, we would come here.

Review Text: Despite it being absolutly packed during pride, all the tables are clean and they managed to get a table order drink to me super quickly!
Generous portion of Fish and Chips. Meal comes with a beer of your choice for £11.72 .
I love this place for my lunch and breakfast. Nice staff, cheap Prices and Amazing food.

Busy pride weekend
Used the app. Food and drink came well within a reasonable amount of time
Staff were lovely and the ramen noodles were amazing!
As Spoons go, this one's pretty decent. I've been to the one near Piccadilly station and the one near St Peter's Square, this is the best out of the three, hands down.

Me & my lovely sister in law went in tonight 9/7/23 we loved it in there but we was told it was closing to have a new bar fitted, hope your not closed to long we were probably the oldest one in there 😊😊😊

Great place for a drink, weatherspoons with outside sitting area too. Will always see something interesting characters around definitely recommend it if you are into pubs. A place to casually come and have a drink.
One of the best wetherspoons I have been to, not full of plonkies or plonkers. Would highly recommend this bar..
This is a great pub in Manchester. The Management and staff are very accommodating. There were around 35-40 people in our group, so it a perfect place for large groups and in a great location.
Decent place, decent food. Drinks were good. Cheap as always with spoons.

Had miners benedict  Black pudding was thin so very dry. Eggs were a little overcook, so not runny yokes .
It's cheap enough so can't complain
Great breakfast, good coffee and usual customers in spoons, like me lol. Worth every penny for breakfast and free refills of hot drinks
If you looking for cheap beer, this is the place to go in Manchester,  however be aware that there is no music available here so you have to create your own atmosphere.

Busy Wetherspoon in Manchester. Food was ok, got the mixed grill. Got to say all the meat was very tough and one cut tasted weird. I appreciate it didn't cost much though. I would have given 2 stars for the meal. However, the staff were great though, friendly and very helpful
Friendly staff hot tastey food USB chargers
I would of given 5 stars but I asked for my steak to be done medium to well done. The 1st half of the steak was perfect but then the rest was still mooing. But apart the service was quick

Really clean and tidy but it was breakfast time.

Waiter was so rude the order taker messed up the other and seemed very uninterested and didn't listen to anything we said overall not a great experience

A bustling pub with a good variety of beers in offer.
There's plenty of seating and tables and staff are helpful.
I didn't try the food. Much better that the piccadilly wetherspoons. A much better class of clientele.

One of the... worst wetherspoons I've been to in Manchester. Staff are wonderful, friendly and attentive, but that doesn't seem to be enough. Tables filthy, long waits to have tables cleared of glasses. Garlic bread was ridiculously greasy with oil. In the women's toilets, drugs were being taken and women acting irresponsibly. Security need to be a bit tougher and do patrols.
Good curry, beer was nice and the rest rooms were clean considering it was a match day.
As far as Wetherspoons goes, this is a pretty nice one. Of course, it's still spoons, so don't expect anything fancy.
Amazing and friendly customer service from Russ from start to finish and even told his manager at the time. Also found my sunglasses. Top lad. Cheers

Damien the manager at this place is an absolute legend , I left my wallet in here after the Manchester marathon and had already travelled back to Yorkshire when I realised my error  . Cheers Damien 🤙🏻
Good food, very good and accessible different beer, very good coffee, Lavazza brand with refill.
Very busy pub, served quickly, tables cleared and cleaned. A good selection of beers, wines and spirits at very competitive rates. A good experience.
Very much a typical Wetherspoons, very busy on my visit for a Sunday breakfast. Gave my friend some one else's breakfast and brought a second with mine!

Staff initially seemed slightly overwhelmed though the Chef personally bade us bon appetit, very curtious.
We had a very enjoyable afternoon on Saturday with a good choice of drinks and reasonable prices.

The best Wetherspoons pub to visit in central Manchester. Good variety of beers & ales with loads of good deals on drinks & food. Can get very busy at weekends/ but with excellent bar staff it does not take to long to be served considering the amount of customers. Also got to mention if you calling in on a weekend the two door staff are top blokes who have been on the doors for years keeping everyone safe absolute Legends. So definitely worth a visit Great place to meet up to start the night off.

It’s a Wetherspoons what else needs saying Good range of vegan foods of an evening and excellent vegan breakfast. It was busy but service was quick and the food was again good and amazing prices . The evening meal having a sneaky double dropped into our drinks .
Cheap place for taking some Drinks....Always full with people. 😁👍 …

Nipped in for some breakfast and went for the American breakfast, eggs, sausage, bacon, hash browns, maple syrup and pancakes, for the price it was a good portion and very nice. Usual big space like all weatherspoons, welcoming and friendly staff.
It's a Weatherspoons so you know what you're going to get. Staff all seem nice and the place seems well managed.
Good as a English bar. More of contemporary e flush and with young crowd. Wide range of drinks and good food. It’s a great place for college friends to hang out.
Always busy so you know your gonna wait a while,so you know you will be waiting. But they are faster then you expect.

went with friends good company the food and service was good even though it was busy

Review Text: They do lovely meals, and a very fast service, I like that you buy one cup of coffee or tea and you can go up as many times as you like, because I like a cup with my meal, and I like a second cup after
Nice and friendly staff, food not bad, does what it says on the tin. Superb idea to be able to order on the app and not have to queue.
Came for a quick drink before a show. Quick service. The staff were friendly and helpful. The desserts were good too

Decent food, well priced and central location. Always a good selection of beers available. Can be very popular ,so you may experience a wait for food at peak times (waiting time for food at 11:00 on Friday 25/01 was 30mins)

It’s just a spoons, with spoons clientele. But it’s decent and the prices are cheap.

£3 for a pint of stowford press

10/10 for this wetherspoons as I don't have to climb 10 flights of stairs to go to the toilets. Decent pint too
Not the best establishment, ordered four drinks two where wrong and nearly charged for someone else's round.
Sound as expected for a Wetherspoons.....good value breakfast and handy after a train journey into Manchester.

The accessible bathroom was one of the best I've ever been to (I'm a wheelchair user). Had breakfast a few times and a couple of beers , its not the best or the worse breakfast it is good value for what you pay I suggest you order the large breakfast as the traditional is a bit small.
Great place. Lots of inside and outside seating, quite good prices and good atmosphere.

Just waiting for my meal to arrive. Gave me food poisoning, stole my money, got my orders wrong multiple times and gave me meat  multiple times when I'm a vegan, they served me burnt food and undercooked food, they left food out of my order, they insulted one of my friends for ordering two desserts, and have given us dirty plates, cutlery and cups multiple times. Lovelymplace to get apint lovely atmosphere

it's a Wethers so passing trade...all drinks served in the relevent branded glasses which is a rarety nowadays

Not expecting 5 star Michelin food from weatherspoons...but at least remove the PLASTIC from my FROZEN lasagna when you take it out of the microwave, come on! Gordon Ramsay would be so disappointed.

I got my lasagne but the middle of it was stone cold and not even heated up properly had to wasted my time chasing down a waitress to heat it up properly. Not only did I had to fish out a huge piece of plastic that was left on my plate. It completely ruined the time that I had there and I definitely WONT be back for the food!

Usual Weatherspoons. Very much if a muchness. Great choice of beers. Reasonably priced food. Although it has to be said, it was a little below par.

service with a smile.... think girl that served us missed that lesson

A nice Spoon with a good selection of beers.
Typical Wetherspoons. Down to earth, no frills but good for prices and an old fashioned pub experience.

One of the best spoons in town. Further out from the city centre, so it's usually less busy and finding a table isn't impossible. But still close to other pubs and clubs on Oxford road. Pretty chill and a cool and unusual layout. Been loads and never had a bad night here 👍 …
Not the greatest Wetherspoons in manchester. Good social distancing measures on place. The place feels tired and dirty, food wasn't great either.
Good value breakfast as you would expect from this establishment.

Review Text: As Wetherspoons go, this one is solid. Big inside, always full of course, but there's a raised seating area at the back which is often overlooked where you might be able to grab a seat.

It was ok. The table service was a little slow, but admittedly it was a busy time when I was there. I ordered food and it came quickly but then waited ages for my pint, which I had to ask a staff member to chase up. The staff were polite and helpful and would go back as it's very convenient for oxford road station. 👍 …
Very busy in the evening and night. Nice place to hang around with drinks and food. The service was fast.
Cool place with a great atmosphere and the service real fast..
Massive interior, split over two levels. The usual range of craft beers and food available at budget friendly prices.
Very busy but got a table straight away. Table service is fast and efficient by friendly staff. Food was nice and hot and all orders were correct. Great atmosphere. Would visit again.
Great taste for an amazing low price for that quality. Is a must while in Manchester

Good food and a lovely spot out in the sun, the table service via the app is always a positive although the wait time for some drinks did reach 20 minutes for a round at a time that wasn't overly busy. A great  wetherspoons   fantastic  staff (who work hard) which  really  does make  the place  and  the  foods great  to  10/10  🤝👍👏👏👏👏 …
One of the best pubs, I go every Sunday without fail.. one of the best places to hangout

(For reference I was here from around opening time)

The Venue; large open plan, with a small upstairs area and a fair outside dining area. Looked clean at first glance, however tables were sticky and slightly dirty, not too bad.

I ordered the large breakfast w/ halloumi + scrambled eggs. (I'll be rating everything for worst to best on the plate)

1. Halloumi - burnt to a f**King crisp all I could tast was yesterday's fry up. 3/10

2. Egg - tasted like a fake plastic tea set egg, with centre so dry it needed my tears to rehydrate. 4/10

3. Beans - standard can't complain. 6/10

4. Scrambled eggs - nothing to complain about, just need to add salt/pepper to liking and your good 👍  6/10

5. Bacon - slightly burnt and tasted like it had been cooked in the mouldy halloumi pan, but not too bad, smoky and tasty, probably to some ppls liking. Does the job 6/10

6. Sausage - exactly what your expecting, nice decent size, sausage. Slightly looks like a dogs 🐕 wiener but I ain't complaining 7/10

7. Hash brown - its hard to miss the mark here and they don't. Lovely, fluffy potato 🥔  probably asdas own brand, banging 9/10

Overall = 6/10 which is good for a spoons, yes there is better out there, but you don't come for the best, you come for half decent at low price.

And I did finish everything(aside from 1 slab of halloumi) so can't complain.  👍

All day brunch was awful, not even properly cooked, missed the mushrooms off the order and then brought me some raw microwaved mushrooms. Not expecting 5 star Michelin food from weatherspoons...but at least remove the PLASTIC from my FROZEN lasagna when you take it out of the microwave, come on! Gordon Ramsay would be so disappointed.

I got my lasagne but the middle of it was stone cold and not even heated up properly had to wasted my time chasing down a waitress to heat it up properly. In the end, it was still  rubbery and dry, definitely not creamy at all! How can you make a lasgne taste so crumpsty?? Not only did I had to fish out a huge piece of plastic that was left on my plate. It completely ruined the time that I had there and I definitely WONT be back for the food!

All day brunch was awful, not even properly cooked, missed the mushrooms off the order and then brought me some raw microwaved mushrooms. Manager is rude and abrupt to customers, the only good thing about this place is prices. Toilets dirty, table was sticky, pretty low standards even for a wetherspoons.

We visited as a group after finishing an all-night hospitality shift for a breakfast and an after-work alcoholic beverage.
My friend asked what time alcohol was being served and the bold Greek bartender with a beard and stretched ears assumed we had all been drinking, even after explaining we had been working. I politely asked the bar tender for an apology to my friend, which he didn't. I spoke to the manager on shift and she refused to give me the name of the bar tender for this review. NOT INDUSTRY FRIENDLY, IMPOLITE AND RUDE. Breakfast wasn't even that nice, the scrambled eggs were over cooked and the hash browns were cold.

Food had no taste, had an English breakfast, it was horrible. Cutlery dirty, greasy and stained with whatever it was on them, clearly not clean. Hygiene is bad here. They say take your own drinks off the tray due to Covid, but they took my cash without issues, also it's  more likely to be spread by the cutlery they give you . Place is not clean. Waste of time amd money, not visiting this one again.

Definitely the worst Wetherspoons we have ever been in ..... especially during these Covid 19 times .
Seemed great at first ... greeted and asked to fill out contact tracing at entrance  .... then told to go and find a table 👍🏻
All unoccupied tables were filthy, covered in dirty plates ,cutlery, napkins and leftover food . Eventually sat down upstairs on a little table which only had dirty cutlery left on it , moved it to another full dirty table.
The place felt dirty and dank 😟
Food ordered , came quickly which was great however it was so bland apart from the “old oil” taste ... and we all had semi cooked chips 😟
We left most of our meals and vacated the place ASAP 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻

Shocking service and bad attitude from bar staff. Put order in waited 25 minutes, one of the staff noticed we had waited a long time, he went to a member of bar staff to ask about are drinks and he was told that we had to wait, then we noticed another member of bar staff go to a bin and pulled a handful of receipts out of the bin and are's  was one that had bin put in the bin. We ordered a second round of drinks when it went quite and had to wait another 25 minutes, we felt as though we were being punished because a member of the staff had enquired about are first round of drinks.
We brought it to the attention of the lady manager about what had happened.
In all the weatherspoons we have bin in over the past 2 day's in Manchester it was the worst and poorly run bar.

I ordered a slice of cheese, halloumi and some garden peas and they told me it was food waste. Even though the food was to accompany our meals and was eaten. Apparently the chefs were getting annoyed which was unfair. Feel very judged for the food I eat.

Hated it, nice place to sit but if you have specific food requirements or allergies don't eat the food. I was served someone else's chilli that had been reheated (rice included, already in the chilli) with bits of chilli already on the tortilla chips and also a bit of cheese.  This was supposed to have been a vegan dish.
This flouts so many rules, cross contamination, food allergens and the reheating of rice which is one of the worst things to cause food poisoning. Never mind the fact that someone else had already been eating this dish.

I entered the venue alone, ordered a beer and was just drinking it in a remote place, not being in anyone's way, all of the sudden, after 20 minutes of being there I am approached by 2 female managers in their 40's or so (one with glasses), telling me to move away as apparently I am in someone's way, even though, for 20 or so minutes nobody was anywhere near there. I am alone, just trying to somehow enjoy a bit of Halloween, but it's too much asked from this place that prides itself as one where everyone can feel at home (at least that is what I've been told), what a lie.. Those 2 "hospitality professionals" ruined my evening before it even began. "Thank you so very much".

Nice building, fine if you want just a drink. Hopeless in every other way, food service was beyond terrible. Ordered food with their new app. Starters came within 15 minutes. After an hour of waiting I asked an employee if he could check where the mains were, "so you want your mains now do you" was the snotty reply. After an hour and twenty we got our mains. Which had obviously been under a heat lamp for a while... After two hours we had to ask for our puddings. Just beyond hopeless

Manager rudely told me and my three friends to leave as our table was not making enough money this was after ordering a full meal and at least 2 drinks each. The grand total time spent inside was 90 minutes. While packing up he returned to intimidate us and tell us to never do this again this was highly embarrassing and upsetting.

Ate here last night food was ok so thought we would come for breakfast the staff were lovely it was clean well organized ordered 2 traditional and coffee the breakfast was cold very cold so if you want a hot breakfast don't use this place sorry staff you were lovely but the food not so

The manager, Damien, took our drinks off our table when we got up to order food when they were still half full. When we asked where they had gone he ignored us. When we inquired further he told us to jog on and put a complaint in and then proceeded to ignore us every time. Shame because the rest of the staff were lovely and the food was fast and fresh, but his service has left a sour taste in our mouths and none of our group will be returning. When we asked another staff member why he was ignored us he told us that he does it with everyone. Terrible manager.

Phoned up and asked if I could reserve a table as I was going to be coming in with a party of 15. Was told that "they can't reserve tables". Considering I've seen them do this so many times I find that hard to believe. Ended up squashed in a corner on a small table. And all because I assume we weren't a big company or something who they'd be more than happy to accommodate for. Bit disappointing really but then it's spoons so they don't really care 😂

1 star is too good for this place!!! Disgusting attitude of management ... Told table was reserved from 6pm.. Which was actually no problem for us. But at 5.30pm we were asked to leave as the customers were in and wanted the table...even though we had just finished our meal and were still waiting for  our dessert.. When we asked for the manager he accused US of being 'awkward'!!!! If I thought it was possible to reserve a table in Wetherspoons we would reserve one every weekend. Manager was lacking in customer service skills and was happy to fuel an argument on the shop floor in front of other customers  who were also disgusted at the sudden request for us to vacate the table prior to the original request of 6pm!

Waited over half an hour after ordering my drinks when asked staff when my order would be getting to my table they were extremely rude.
I understand they're busy but the response received when asking was horrendous customer service 👎👎 …

Rubbish , dirty table which staff never thought to clean before putting food down. Had chicken curry ,chicken was hard popper dims greasy,was never asked about the meal . Just have you finished . Was going to complain but couldn't wait to get out.

Had the traditional breakfast here three days in a row. Every time the food was cold, also had missing items from the order such as toast and hashbrowns. Unfortunately the food was so cold on one occasion it had to be sent back to the kitchen as the meal was not even fully cooked.  Better off going to the Waterhouse nearby for consistent quality of cooking.

Light meal before theatre visit
Place clean and tidy
Ordered from the 2 for £10.49
Had small fish and chips
About 12 chips and a ? Piece of fish smaller than a fish finger coated ++ in batter
Very disappointed  spoke to the manager who informed me they come in all weighing the same?
Shame really we frequent the establishment nearly every month prior to our theatre visits but I was embarrassed to see my friends portion and say I had "treated her to a meal"

Bar service was a little hectic, tried to serve me twice before other people that had been waiting longer then me. Bar was very sticky. Alot of tables hadnt been seen to (the tables next to us and our table has glasses from previous drinkers throughout our stay). there was spilt alcohol on the stairway to the indoor balcony. Pretty badly time managed as they had plenty of staff behind the bar, some not doing much but plenty of upkeep to be done.

Stood at bar patiently for 10 mins, wasn't busy, the bar staff served 4 people that were behind me then proceeded to serve a man that just walked up. Seems  they don't care about customer satisfaction. Didn't even bother saying sorry after I had told them what they did.

Went here for a retirement. About 20 of us. Spent £100s in there. Then told we had to leave because 1 person in the group was more intoxicated than the rest. What a joke.
Also the Pitchers was dirty with lip mark on it.
We went Turtle Bay next door. Should of gone there from the start 😡😡

BBQ pulled chicken topped chips were chips with shredded chicken breast with BBQ sauce drizzled on top,BBQ chicken cheese melt was an odd texture and the cheese wasn't melted and the bacon was rock hard,got a full refund thankfully but it's put us off wetherspoons food unfortunately.

Worst feed I've ever paid for, you get get exactly what you pay for, cheap slop. Went for the mushroom risotto and pork ribs and was violently ill for the entire evening afterwards. Quality control doesn't appear to be in place whatsoever. Never again!

Okay, it's big and easy to find if you're using it as a location for meeting people, but that's the end of the good stuff!  It's completely soulless and usually full of people who are absolutely drunk as a skunk, loaded with shopping bags, or look slightly down on their luck and are having a rare pint.  Not a huge choice of beers, most of which are served from chilled pumps so they are actually uncomfortable to drink, and Sky Sports permanently on their huge TV screens which usually have the clientèle staring in their direction rather than chatting.  There's a dining section at the back but there are many, many places I'd prefer to eat rather than trying this place.  An awful pub.
Ordered using the app and our drinks were forgotten. Left on bar and eventually thought during our very disappointing meal. Drive through burger was Luke warm, would not recommend
Had a large mixed grill and the best part of the meal was the peas.. meat burnt and very fatty. Not up to normal standards I've had at other Wetherspoons

Unbelievable. After paying for a meal at the pub, me and my sister had 20 minutes to wait for our train home. I started to do my makeup whilst my sister was watching the tv. The manager came over to us and told my sister to sit up properly or  leave. This rule and demanding attitude shocked me as I work in a different Wetherspoons. After a couple minutes, the manager came back and grabbed my open makeup bag, causing some to drop on the floor, and began to take it outside to leave on the floor. When I was coming back to the table to retrieve my other belongings, he grabs them as well as trying to grab my sister and continues outside with them. The disgusting way he did all this when we was not doing anything wrong was absolutely appalling, leaving other customers sat close shocked. Out of order. I would avoid this Wetherspoons at all costs. Disgusting.

It's a Saturday night staff can't cope with clearing tables and serving at bar so hubby returned glasses to bar and was rudely informed he should not be putting glasses on edge of bar as it's separate serving area the way staff spoke to my husband was disgusting what do you expect back in return last time we shall be returning customer services skills very lacking!!
Door staff really excellent. Bar staff decent but 35 minutes wait for drinks from the app is unacceptable.

Gave us vegetarian instead of vegan (and gave the higher price). Gave us 1 large breakfast instead of the 3 we ordered. Should've made the tea like in other locations, gave just the cup instead. Overall bad experience.

The manager took mine and my friends drinks away that were full and never returned them when I politely asked as he just put them behind the bar. He then told me to go find them myself. Also forever blanked me and my friends asking for our drinks. Not only this, he also put his hands on me to move me away from the bar when I was complaining to the bar staff. Damian or Damon was his name and he had no respect for anyone. He is a horrible person and a joke of a manager and even his colleagues agreed with me. Will never be returning.

Ordered a cheese and ham panini, the panini was buttered inside and had a tiny amount of cheese and ham. Not enough filling to even fill one quarter of it . There was only about a teaspoon of cheese on it and very little ham. First time here and will be the last for food

Very rude arrogant and ignorant staff waited at the bar 10 mins and the tall lad dark hair completely ignored us and thought it was funny not to serve us , we go in wetherspoons all the time but have lost confidence in this branch ......avoid this branch people......even the manager was to busy for his customers

It's spoons. Slow service, wrong meals when they eventually turn up. Staff miserable with a can't be bothered attitude.  What more can you say!!!
I came in and asked nicely for napkins. The bar woman replied in a rude way and was not helpful at all. Poor customer service.
Ripped off on a cold bacon butty. Supposed to be 3 rashers of bacon but was 3 pieces (1rasher and 2 halves o) of cold thin bacon. Showed Manager who dismissed me abruptly saying he counted 3 rashers.

Not happy whilst my friend went to the ladies one of the management attempted to remove her drink, bottle and personal from the table by putting his grubby hands on them .When confronted he just put the down and left with no apology

Wow, found a hair in my burger, took it to the counter, the guy behind the counter got the manager, she came over asked what the problem was, I showed her the hair and she asked what meal I had, I told her I didn't want another meal, she said "that's fine" and walked off, no apology or anything.
Never again plastic pots when it suits staff waited for drinks more concerned with people using the  app
Dirty mugs and terrible service. They got our breakfast order wrong twice before and insisted that "That's what you ordered" And the coffee mugs were filthy.
Way too busy and loud, I know it's a spoons but after a long day all you want is a pint and I kept getting overlooked cause the bar staff would rather serve a noisy group of lads never go back
Stole my mates real ID claiming it’s fake awful rude staff long haired freak was horrible boss was dodgy ,alll wrong sack them alll
The only wetherspoons in the country not to swap breakfast items, I was Dissapointed with this news and the manager was not helpful in supporting me as a customer.
Waited 1hr for food order. Very unhelpful and short tempered staff.
Bar manager has no clue how to deal with people and rather than do his job will try to ruin other people's night.
Called in to kill time waiting for a train ordered a pint of Doombar which was served in a hot glass which completely ruined it.Will not be calling again
Terrible beer tasted very chemically. Probably the worst wetherspoons i have ever been too.
Shocking! Drunk students. Uninterested staff. Dirty tables. Worst Wetherspoons we have been to.
Food must have been under the heater lamp for ages. Food late and dry and refunded.

Staff are too busy serving people that use the app to bother with people waiting at the bar.
Appalling food,had to give it back twice due to it being cold,and if you are vegetarian forget it,got a refund.
Like most Witherspoons it’s like the Mos Eisley cantina without the music.

Literally been in this afternoon for lunch, thought it'd be lovely to grab a burger deal and pop back to work. Slightly later than my usual time this time i was there around 13.15. Ordered the burger and soft drink. Maximum time i waited since started to come in this restaurant about 4 years ago was around 20 , if not 25 minutes. This time I had to leave after 45 minutes without waiting the food to arrive,  because really had to go. This does not mean I will not be coming in again, however still wanted to share with public as I think service is usually alright.

Visited the paramount and because we are non smokers we sat outside in the clearly signposted no smoking area. For the 1 hour or so that we stayed there a young couple on the next table must have smoked around 5 cigarettes each and as usual happens to non smokers the breeze blew the smoke our way.
The young couple were sat at a window seat with the large sign saying no smoking looking at them and also the staff delivered drinks to there table on more than one occasion and never said anything to them.
Disgusting selfish smokers and staff that should be doing there job.

Very busy establishment even at 11.30am. However service very poor & have to queue for 20 minutes to get your order. If order on line through app also 20 minute wait. Outside area grossly untidy with tables full of empty glasses & finished plates & cutlery. Not impressed.

Service here was very slow and the food order was basically lost for me while others at the table got theirs despite me ordering at the bar way before others has completed theirs on the app. The apps payment process failed for me however.
The server I complained to about the issue was very apologetic and sorted the issue quite promptly though.

Food wasn't right order was wrong, waited far too long for drinks and friend has dairy allergy  and sent food with dairy in, had to send back and second time round it still wasn't right.

Service very poor and seats were dirty and unfit for sitting on , very poor overall.
The best place to get drunk and sticky pizza if you’ve got no other purpose in life.

City centre Wetherspoons pub, a slightly better atmosphere than its Oldham counterpart, cleaner and more up to date interior. Slightly higher prices as you would expect in a city centre. Customers are not as selfish when trying to get served at the bar and will tell the staff who is before them and wait their turn 👍 …

Ordered steak and salad. Over cooked jacket potato, decaying unwashed salad and stone cold tough steak. Glad I ordered a side of peas because even though they were cold and like little bullets they were just about edible.

Had breakfast here. Ordered at bar, for tables outside, got drinks as well. Sat outside and got told off by a member of staff for having glass containers outside. We pointed out that the people at the bar knew full well we were sitting outside. She threw a strop and took our drinks off inside to replace for plastic containers. Next time maybe ask the customer before accusing!

Dont like to give bad reviews especially for a wetherspoons but this one is the worst iv been in. At 4.30pm sat afternoon, they had no bottles of white wine only the expensive one at £15.45, plus none of our first choice food. This is either poor management of stock or a very good marketing ploy. City center or not it's was just as busy as everywhere else. Won't be going again

I have eaten at wetherspoons all over the uk and Ireland  and never ever have I had a worse meal than the one I had today. The Gammon was so over cooked it was like shoe leather, peas were dry , eggs overcooked and dry, chips and mushroom were ok and staff pleasant, drinks good value. Nice place but just don't bother eating here.
Tried to go in last night at 9pm 25th refused as they had no tables for two. But had tables for more than 2 they were not busy. Won't bother in future.

Enjoyable bar close to town centre, unfortunately waitress/barmaid wasn't very good, walked round asking people who ordered what food. Wasn't paying full attention as her friends were in and was pre occupied with them.

Had food poisoning from this place on two separate occasions (I didn't learn my lesson the first time!), but as with all Wetherspoons, it's almost to be expected. No music, no frills, but cheap as anything.
Definitely not one if the better wetherspoon's we've been in. Breakfast tasted OK but all four plates were only luke warm. 🤔 …

It's a Weatherspoons... You don't go to a 'Spoons for the ambience. Or for the quality of the beer / food. Or for the service. In fact I struggle to identify ANY particular reason for subjecting yourself to this kind of experience. I think you generally go to 'Spoons because your skint and cheap beer seems like an acceptable trade-off for running the risk of having a run-in with a piss-soaked, angry tramp. It should be noted, however, that all Weatherspoons have a higher class of tramp than you might find elsewhere.
I love spoons. This wasn't a great experience as I know spoons though. Food average and drinks didn't turn up for half an hour and I had to go and chase them.

I ordered a pint of Phoenix IPA as part of a round of drinks. My mate had been drinking Pheonix IPA all night.  This idiot Irish bar tender who looked about 15 years old started pouring a pint of Wobbly Bob. I stopped him and said, "no, I want Pheonix IPA", so he continued pouring it telling me I was wrong and the only Pheonix brewery beer they sold was Wobbly Bob. I told him I didn't want Wobbly Bob, so he asked another bar person, who duly pointed to the correct pump for Pheonix IPA (which was at the other end of the bar). So he came back and asked me to pay for the drinks he had poured. I said that I didn't want Wobbly Bob  I wanted Pheonix IPA. Amazingly, he repeated that Wobbly Bob was the only Pheonix beer they sold.  So I pointed out to this idiot, that I had just watched him ask his colleague and it was in that pump over there. He then demanded I pay for the drinks he had poured (including the Wobbly Bob). I said no, pour me a Pheonix IPA first.  With much reluctance he eventually poured me a Pheonix IPA and I paid him for the drinks I ordered. Why did I have to argue with this idiot?

I have been drinking in pubs for almost 35 years and have never experienced such a blatant attempt to give you something you did not order in a pub in my life. The fact he repeatedly tried to trick me into paying for a drink I had not ordered is bad, however when you consider Wobbly Bob is a very strong beer, this is utterly irresponsible. The guy who served me should be sacked.

This happened on Tuesday  12/03/19.
I go here on a regular basis and the breakfast is usually ok. Today everything was burnt and I didn't complain and I wished I had.
Poor service. That app means half of the staff are attending to that while the bar gets clogged up. 3 bar staff just not enough. Mr Wetherspoon sort your life out. Just saying
Staff dont seem to be able to comprehend a simple request to have no egg with the breakfast. Apart from that food was standard Wetherspoons quality.
Very slow service at the bar for drinks. Seemed to be a lot of staff but not many pulling pints.
Warm beer and very poor food compared to usual Witherspoon's meals.
Good choice of beer, but food standard wasn't up to par. Miserable staff, unclean environment.
Kind of sad pub... poor light and plastic glasses. Nice staff and great price.
Pricey for a weatherspoons. The Waterfront (weatherspoons) is 6 mi ute walk away and cheaper prices
Good location superb drinks selections ,lots of food options however no music ?? Which kills the ambiance
The food wasnt up fo standards i had fo send it back
Staff were lovely. Breakfast came out cold though.
The manager is rude and ignorant and wouldn’t allow us to buy any more drinks on the app because we were ‘using it too much’ it’s our money at the end of the day, won’t be coming again
Cheap and dirty. Can't expect anything else if your owner is a brexiter...
Queuing outside to get in. But that might have been because of the football being on on Saturday

I ordered food and it came quickly but then waited ages for my pint, which I had to ask a staff member to chase up. The staff were polite and helpful and would go back as it's very convenient for oxford road station. 👍 …

Ok it's a witherspoon so don't expect music. Cheap and affordable.  Was busy on a Tuesday night but the staff all braved smiles on their faces. Had a few nice pints.

Centre of Manchester so good to just chill and relax

I love weatherspoons but over the years of eating there I have found the change of meals being offered has gone down in my opinion. You can no longer get the half roast chicken, 14oz Aberdeen  steak and now they have taken off the 10oz gammon. Might have to start looking else where which will be a shame. My rating is based on what food has been taken off that myself and late brother liked .

Have drank here much over the years. It's a Weatherspoons so it's exactly what you see is what you get. Cheap drinks and food and a lot of tables, it's popular with students and people on a night out. If you want your basic beers and ciders you'll be satisfied, if you want watery and awful tasting pitchers of 'cocktails' you'll also love it. If you don't want the latter I'd suggest finding a bar that caters specifically more to it.

It's fine serves food at reasonable prices and the prices do reflect what you get which is no frills a meal for two will cost 14 pounds which is fair for the centre / I would say its basic food but prices are basic too

Wasn't the best experience. Busy place but really just 1 member of staff serving at the bar. Was told to use the app as its quicker. However everyone was complaining about a 15 to 20 minute wait for orders to be served.

Your standard whethersoons really but the service was quite poor. The guy who served us, (possibly the supervisor due to his different uniform and comment about long waits) wasn't the most polite. Good food and drink. But the wait is long. What ever you do, don't sit at the back or the pub at table 13. If they had any sense here they would remove those tables for the comfort of their customers. If this had not been my experience I'd have given 5 stars.

Not bad.  Decent prices, but half my breakfast was lukewarm, the rest was piping hot.  Service was pretty quick, civil but not exactly warm and friendly.  It's a Wetherspoon's, you get what you pay for.

Had traditional breakfast sausage and hash browns were hot rest were cold. Same as the Waterhouse. Plates were cold so food was cold. Wasn't like that before COVID. One coffee machine only had chocolate and hot milk!
Its fine cheap prices and clean food was cheap but literally dumped on plate .Had the vegan burger which was fine /meal for two was 7 each so not too bad for a quick business lunch /its fine

We were there on Friday and it was ok. We sat outside since the sun was shining. The food was good and so were the cocktails although we had to keep asking them to add some fruit. A cocktail needs fruit and not just lemon and lime! They also looked at our Scottish notes as if we were trying to con them!! Our money has the same value as theirs and should be accepted anywhere in England!! Also, we went back on Saturday and the 2 drinks we had on Friday were £6 and on Saturday they were £8.40. That's not fair to paying customers to rip them off because it's the weekend. That's just greed!!

A large city centre pub in a modern building. Good real ale selection and very popular for mid morning breakfasts with local construction workers, students in the afternoon and everyone in the evening

Food was normal but wouldn't swap bacon for sausage in breakfast. They were happy to take the bacon off but wanted to charge me extra for more sausage. Never a problem in other wetherspoons. Won't be going again

Typical Wetherspoon's. Pretty tough to find seating at lunch time, which is good for the business, but a bit frustrating as a customer! Get in early. Last time I visited my food never arrived, so I had to watch everyone else eat, but it was easy getting a refund at the bar.

Not a bad Wetherspoon. The only problem we had when ordering was they weren't exactly sure what table was what. We had a few issues of getting people who had ordered from another table and visa versa. Staff polite thou. Shame some meals were unavailable at the time

Went here for breakfast after a night out, restaurant had not been cleaned very well (if at all) from the night before. Food was OK but looked rushed. Tea/coffee area filthy with rubbish everywhere. Ladies toilets were all out of toilet roll even though staff toilet check list had been signed 🤔 …

called for Breakfast instead of paying the Premier Inn around the corner, had the Traditional Breakfast with the Black pudding option, I cannot believe a pub in Lancashire does not know how to cook it properly, burnt and crispy isn't the correct taste for Black pudding. Tea and coffee free refills are great and the wife had Eggs Royale which was spot on
All tables proper decorated with empty glasses. No one is there to clean. Nice service though n usual beers as in every WetherSpoon. What else i can say 😝 …

Visited Sunday afternoon. Was not full of customers by any means. Had chicken burger & chips. Chips were on the soggy side & the meal could have been served slightly hotter but I know it's always hit & miss when it comes to Wetherspoons food.

Not too bad busy most times good place to go if going to the palace theatre cask ales always well kept bit more expensive than some of the other Weatherspoons in Manchester and could do with a bit of redecorating but ok all in all
Always very busy, lucky to find a table but overall as good as any other spoons, peng pitchers ordered on the app, can't go wrong
Pretty good. Useful app and alright staff. Main issue is how busy it is all the time so hard to find somewhere to sit. Food is good.
Good choice of beers, and prices cheap but staff could be friendlier.  Carpet could do with a good clean.  Cleanliness isn't the best.  Food just ok.

About as typical a Wetherspoons as any, it's unlikely to wow anyone, but carries the typical Wetherspoons fare of a cheap food menu and far cheaper drinks than the other bars in the immediate area. Too busy and noisy to have a relaxing wind down with your mates during peak times, but a perfectly acceptable place to crash when the more exciting places are too packed or too expensive.
This place used to be so much better. Plates and glasses on tables and it wasn't even busy. Good selection of drinks gives this venue its 3 stars
It's your typical weatherspoons, you know what you're going to get with the food and they always have a good selection on beers. Worth a look if you're after a quick drink or somewhere very casual.
Food a bit bland . Dirty tables . Staff really busy so cleanliness not a priority.  Cheap drinks though

It's ok there, but I think all wearherspoons should have same prices.. it cost nearly a pound more for same drinks purchased from other wearherspoons. Having said that, it is a lot cheaper than pubs such as Woodstock or Albert' s who charge far too much, for the same drinks.

Not as rough as some of the other city centre wetherspoons.

Everything you would expect from JDW - good selection of drinks , especially real ales. Large menu at very good prices.
Good venue, helpful staff, food wasn't the best had a breakfast left most of it has bacon and sausages tasted like burnt plastic not good really but great place to grab a coffee or a drink.
Nice clean place, decent no excellent selection of booze and food. slow service at bar, some of the staff could do with more training in customer service
One of several Wetherspoon outlets in the city. Large space with a mezzanine area tends to get very busy but the service is pretty good considering. Standard Wetherspoon food and drink offerings.

Typical weatherspoons breakfast awlful , the egg looks like it got fried 2 days ago lunch so so and searved at medium heat ;  I beleive if good got served hot it would make the world of difference to it
This place is great for cheap drinks especially pres however go at the weekend and its packed full, very hard to sit down or get a drink.
Not bad for a wetherspoons, but even in quiet times it still takes 20 mins+ for food and drinks to arrive.
Looking a little tatty for me. Needs some money spent on furnishing.  Food tasty but gets so crowded on a Saturday, hard to find a table sometimes.

Its a Weatherspoons, in Manchester. Does what other Weatherspoons do. Rammed on an evening not too bad on an afternoon. Drinks well priced, smell of fried food in the air, large pinch of inebriated clientèle give the place a hint of danger and excitement.
Weatherspoons- does exactly what its supposed to. Cheap non brand drinks, cheap cocktails. Lost some atmosphere, but so have most places right now
Spoons. What can I say? Use the app and avoid the queues at the bar! Food hot and as described. Basic and adequate. Brew Dog IPA.
One giant room. Very busy, noisy and boisterous. Great selection of alcohol and food. Not a particularly comfortable place, especially at weekend.
Good range of beers and able to get a seat. It's a weatherspoons so you know what you're getting but it's decent enough
Decent food .poor service and cleanliness wasn't good. Untidy and table a mess didn't clean when asked
Standard Wetherspoons in a city centre. A worrying mix of people but serves fairly good beer cheaply. The food is ok if you're on a budget.

Visited for breakfast was a average spoons breakfast, coffee from the refill machine is a great idea however I only wanted one as it was shockingly bad very bitter and burnt taste, friend had one from the second machine with no better luck.
Good option for a cheap breakfast/meal, but it's nothing special as far as Wetherspoons go. The toilets are grossly overdecorated though...
Unfortunately they were having problems in the kitchen so the breakfast was cold. But got a refund in the end after other people also complained
Very busy for breakfast on a Sunday. Hard to find table however food nice for a spoons
Not great food but well priced and decent coffee as you would expect from a Wetherspoons
Same standard you'd expect from weatherspoons.  Sport was on and it was too loud bit crowded but OK as food was well prepared. Didn't stick about after that though.
It is what it is. Food always good value and well presented but uninspiring. Beer kept ok, ok range, ok price.
Good choice of beers and cheap food and drink as with any Wetherspoons. But service is so slow especially at busy times.
Local friendly pub, gets quite busy as it's in the centre of Manchester. I had lunch there and it was freshly made, very nice.
Usual spoons experience. Very hard to get a seat a lot of the time. Good selection of beers.

It's a Wetherspoon. It feels wrong to even have an opinion about this, but I still think Moon Under The Water on Deansgate serves the best quality food out of the other branches in Manchester City centre.
Took forever to be let in and get served I know it was a matchday but 40 minutes is ridiculous.
Good quick service, nice food and Wainwrights bitter
Food was ok but £6.40 for half a pint of coke and a small jacket potatoe with cheese and beans . Rip off to be honest .
Poor bar service. Not enough bar staff. Other than that nice place pleasent staff
Very cheap. Some food can be surprisingly good, other stuff not so. Choose carefully.
Great for meeting placen good prices for drinks, always very, very busy and very noisy not a good place for a quiet chat!
I visited late on a Sunday night.. So the place was empty.. Very loud music. Staff was OK beer was average
1st spoons I've been in where the app order takes longer than going to the bar

Busy, roudy, crowded, a little in need of a refurb.
But a pint and a J20 for £4...

Cheap and cheerful, has a good outside area but does not get much light inside.
Good mixed grill,needs to mix up the real ale. Better choices elsewhere in the city.

Good beer, good prices, bustling, but lacking in atmosphere.
Staff were trying to stick to the rules but there were too many people getting up from their tables and going over to other tables
Breakfast not as good as local Wetherspoons pubs Egg overcooked and very small Bacon dry and altogether badly cooked
Lot of people in for the time of day don't eat in their but food looks good Guinness not the best I have added  in Manchester
